intro: Rubus discolor var. tomentosus, commonly known as the hairy blackberry, is a variant of the blackberry plant native to parts of Asia. It is characterized by its dark purple to black fruits and hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant belongs to the Rosaceae family and is known for its thorny growth habit. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. The berries are edible, though they are typically smaller and less sweet compared to other blackberry varieties.
